info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 4:23AM EDT until May 16 at 8:28AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
James River At Richmond Westham affecting Chesterfield, Henrico and City of Richmond Counties.
For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...James River at Richmond Westham.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Portions of Riverside Drive begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:50 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 5.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 14.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 10/02/2024. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield, VA; Henrico, VA; City of Richmond, VA
